question.title: Comparator Sort Coordinates
question.content:
You are given an array arr[] of n coordinates. These coordinates are objects of the class Point and contain x and y. You need to sort the array by increasing order of x, and if two x are same then sort by increasing order of y.

Examples:

Input: arr[] = [[1, 2], [3, 4], [5, 6], [7, 8], [9, 0]]
Output: (1,2) (3,4) (5,6) (7,8) (9,0)
Explanation: Sort it in increasing order of x, and if two x are same then sort in increasing order of y. So, by following the logic we get (1,2) (3,4) (5,6) (7,8) (9,0)
Input: arr[] = [[1, 2], [1, 9], [1, 0], [1, 1]]
Output: (1,0) (1,1) (1,2) (1,9)
Explanation: Sort it in increasing order of x, and if two x are same then sort in increasing order of y. Here we see that x are same for all the coordinates so we sort in increasing order of y. Hence we get (1,0) (1,1) (1,2) (1,9).

Constraints:
1 <= arr.length <= 103

hints: Just check if x are same for two then compare by y.

(p1,p2)->p1.x-p2.x==0?p1.y-p2.y:p1.x-p2.x)

Use this in the Arrays.sort() comparator.
